(8) Yet Another Maturity Model?

Source: CNCF Platform Engineering Maturity Model



Your Workshop Mike Amundsen & Erik Wilde: Workshop Introduction

(9) Maturity Models

The true outcome of a maturity model assessment isn't what level you are but the list of things you need to work on to improve. Your current level is merely a piece of intermediate work in order to determine that list of skills to acquire next. (Martin Fowler, Maturity Model, August 2014) [https://martinfowler.com/bliki/MaturityModel.html]



Your Workshop Mike Amundsen & Erik Wilde: Workshop Introduction

(10) Main Focus: Scope and Potential

  • Understanding the relevant areas
  • Looking at various levels in these areas
  • Aim for optimum instead of maximum
  • Figure out where you are and where you should be
  • Look at patterns and practices that you can learn from
  • Always think about bang for the buck


Your Workshop Mike Amundsen & Erik Wilde: Workshop Introduction

(11) Four Focus Areas

  1. Strategy and Business Alignment [Strategy and Business Alignment]
  2. Product Design, Development, and Management [Product Design, Development, and Management]
  3. Product and Platform Marketing [Product and Platform Marketing]
  4. Governance and Platform [Governance and Platform]
